problem_names:
lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_HomE:
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  obtains f where \<open>Hom \<CC> a b = set {f}\<close> | \<open>Hom \<CC> a b = 0\<close>

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le[cat_order_cs_intros]: 
  assumes "f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le_ex1:
  assumes "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b" and "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  shows "\<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le_ex[elim]:
  assumes "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b" and "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  obtains f where "f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

lemma (in cat_preorder) is_le_refl: 
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> a"

lemma (in cat_preorder) is_le_trans: 
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"
    and "b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c"

lemma (in is_preorder_functor) is_preorder_functor_axioms'[cat_order_cs_intros]:
  assumes "\<alpha>' = \<alpha>" and "\<AA>' = \<AA>" and "\<BB>' = \<BB>"
  shows "\<FF> : \<AA>' \<le>\<^sub>C\<^sub>.\<^sub>P\<^sub>E\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<alpha>'\<^esub> \<BB>'"
translations:
mk_ide rf cat_preorder_def[unfolded cat_preorder_axioms_def]
  |intro cat_preorderI|
  |dest cat_preorderD[dest]|
  |elim cat_preorderE[elim]|

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_HomE:
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  obtains f where \<open>Hom \<CC> a b = set {f}\<close> | \<open>Hom \<CC> a b = 0\<close>

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>\<And>f.
                Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f} \<Longrightarrow> thesis;
     Hom \<CC> a b = []\<^sub>\<circ> \<Longrightarrow> thesis\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<exists>f. Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f}) \<or>
  Hom \<CC> a b = []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>\<And>f.
                Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f} \<Longrightarrow> thesis;
     Hom \<CC> a b = []\<^sub>\<circ> \<Longrightarrow> thesis\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> thesis

proof (state)
this:
  f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Arr\<rparr>
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  \<CC>\<lparr>Dom\<rparr>\<lparr>f\<rparr> = a
  \<CC>\<lparr>Cod\<rparr>\<lparr>f\<rparr> = b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (chain)
picking this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (prove)
using this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>\<And>f.
              Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f} \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis;
   Hom \<CC> a b = []\<^sub>\<circ> \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>
obtain h where "Hom \<CC> a b = set {h}"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>\<And>f.
              Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f} \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis;
   Hom \<CC> a b = []\<^sub>\<circ> \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>h.
        Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {h} \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {h}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {h}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (chain)
picking this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
have "f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b" and "g \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b"

proof (prove)
using this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b &&&
    g \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b

proof (state)
this:
  f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b
  g \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (chain)
picking this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {h}
  f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b
  g \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b

proof (prove)
using this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {h}
  f \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b
  g \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. h = f &&& h = g

proof (state)
this:
  h = f
  h = g

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (chain)
picking this:
  h = f
  h = g

proof (prove)
using this:
  h = f
  h = g

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. f = g

proof (state)
this:
  f = g

goal:
No subgoals!

definition is_le :: "V \<Rightarrow> V \<Rightarrow> V \<Rightarrow> bool" (infix \<open>\<le>\<^sub>O\<index>\<close> 50)
  where "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<longleftrightarrow> Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> 0"

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le[cat_order_cs_intros]: 
  assumes "f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

proof (prove)
using this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le_ex1:
  assumes "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b" and "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  shows "\<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (chain)
picking this:
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>

proof (prove)
using this:
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (chain)
picking this:
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  \<lbrakk>?a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>;
   ?b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> (\<exists>f. Hom \<CC> ?a ?b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f}) \<or>
                    Hom \<CC> ?a ?b = []\<^sub>\<circ>
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>
obtain f where Hom_ab: "Hom \<CC> a b = set {f}"

proof (prove)
using this:
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  \<lbrakk>?a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>;
   ?b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> (\<exists>f. Hom \<CC> ?a ?b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f}) \<or>
                    Hom \<CC> ?a ?b = []\<^sub>\<circ>
  Hom \<CC> a b \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>f.
        Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f} \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. ?a : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
 2. \<And>f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow> f = ?a

proof (state)
this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>fa.
       fa : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow> fa = f

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>fa.
       fa : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow> fa = f

proof (state)
this:
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>fa.
       fa : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow> fa = f

proof (chain)
picking this:
  Hom \<CC> a b = ZFC_in_HOL.set {f}
  g : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

proof (state)
this:
  g = f

goal:
No subgoals!

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal:
No subgoals!

lemma (in cat_preorder) cat_peo_is_le_ex[elim]:
  assumes "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b" and "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>" and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  obtains f where "f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

        f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

using this:
  \<exists>!f. f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  ?f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow> thesis

 1. (\<And>f.
        f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow>

subsubsection\<open>Order relation on a preorder category is a preorder\<close>

lemma (in cat_preorder) is_le_refl: 
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> a"

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a a \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (prove)
using this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<CC>\<lparr>CId\<rparr>\<lparr>a\<rparr>
    \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a a

proof (state)
this:
  \<CC>\<lparr>CId\<rparr>\<lparr>a\<rparr>
  \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a a

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a a \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<CC>\<lparr>CId\<rparr>\<lparr>a\<rparr>
  \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a a

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<CC>\<lparr>CId\<rparr>\<lparr>a\<rparr>
  \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> Hom \<CC> a a

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a a \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a a \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal:
No subgoals!

lemma (in cat_preorder) is_le_trans: 
  assumes "a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>"
    and "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"
    and "b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c"
  shows "a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c"

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c
obtain f where f: "f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b"

proof (prove)
using this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>f.
        f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

proof (state)
this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c
obtain g where g: "g : b \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c"

proof (prove)
using this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  c \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>g.
        g : b \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

proof (state)
this:
  g : b \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : b \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

proof (prove)
using this:
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b
  g : b \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. g \<circ>\<^sub>A\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub>
    f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

proof (state)
this:
  g \<circ>\<^sub>A\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub>
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  g \<circ>\<^sub>A\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub>
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

proof (prove)
using this:
  g \<circ>\<^sub>A\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub>
  f : a \<mapsto>\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

proof (state)
this:
  Hom \<CC> a c \<noteq> []\<^sub>\<circ>

goal:
No subgoals!

locale cat_partial_order = cat_preorder \<alpha> \<CC> for \<alpha> \<CC> +
  assumes cat_po: "\<lbrakk> a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>; b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>; a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b; b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> a \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> a = b"

mk_ide rf cat_partial_order_def[unfolded cat_partial_order_axioms_def]
  |intro cat_partial_orderI|
  |dest cat_partial_orderD[dest]|
  |elim cat_partial_orderE[elim]|

locale cat_linear_order = cat_partial_order \<alpha> \<CC> for \<alpha> \<CC> +
  assumes cat_lo: "\<lbrakk> a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>; b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<CC>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr> \<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> a \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> b \<or> b \<le>\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<CC>\<^esub> a"

mk_ide rf cat_linear_order_def[unfolded cat_linear_order_axioms_def]
  |intro cat_linear_orderI|
  |dest cat_linear_orderD[dest]|
  |elim cat_linear_orderE[elim]|

locale is_preorder_functor = 
  is_functor \<alpha> \<AA> \<BB> \<FF> + HomDom: cat_preorder \<alpha> \<AA> + HomCod: cat_preorder \<alpha> \<BB>
  for \<alpha> \<AA> \<BB> \<FF>

lemma (in is_preorder_functor) is_preorder_functor_axioms'[cat_order_cs_intros]:
  assumes "\<alpha>' = \<alpha>" and "\<AA>' = \<AA>" and "\<BB>' = \<BB>"
  shows "\<FF> : \<AA>' \<le>\<^sub>C\<^sub>.\<^sub>P\<^sub>E\<^sub>O\<^bsub>\<alpha>'\<^esub> \<BB>'"

mk_ide rf is_preorder_functor_def
  |intro is_preorder_functorI|
  |dest is_preorder_functorD[dest]|
  |elim is_preorder_functorE[elim]|
subsubsection\<open>A preorder functor is a faithful functor\<close>

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<FF> : \<AA> \<mapsto>\<mapsto>\<^sub>C\<^bsub>\<alpha>\<^esub> \<BB>
 2. \<And>a b.
       \<lbrakk>a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>;
        b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> v11 (\<FF>\<lparr>ArrMap\<rparr> \<restriction>\<^sup>l\<^sub>\<circ>
                              Hom \<AA> a b)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<FF> : \<AA> \<mapsto>\<mapsto>\<^sub>C\<^bsub>\<alpha>\<^esub> \<BB>
 2. \<And>a b.
       \<lbrakk>a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>;
        b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> v11 (\<FF>\<lparr>ArrMap\<rparr> \<restriction>\<^sup>l\<^sub>\<circ>
                              Hom \<AA> a b)

proof (state)
this:
  a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>
  b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<FF> : \<AA> \<mapsto>\<mapsto>\<^sub>C\<^bsub>\<alpha>\<^esub> \<BB>
 2. \<And>a b.
       \<lbrakk>a \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>;
        b \<in>\<^sub>\<circ> \<AA>\<lparr>Obj\<rparr>\<rbrakk>
